alert.note: Alert for Mono (California) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued January 23 at 3:52AM PST by NWS Reno
info.description: ...GUSTY NORTHEAST WINDS AND DANGEROUS WIND CHILLS ACROSS EASTERN SIERRA RIDGETOPS THROUGH THIS AFTERNOON... Eastern Sierra ridgetop wind gusts of 70-90 mph with occasional gusts in excess of 100 mph out of the northeast will continue through much of the day before gradually tapering off this evening. In addition to possible wind-related recreation impacts, these strong and gusty winds coupled with very cold temperatures will result in dangerous wind chills between 25 and 35 degrees below zero. The coldest of these wind chills will occur during the morning hours. Frostbite can occur to unprotected skin in as little as 30 minutes. If you are heading into the higher elevations, prepare for extreme cold and cover all exposed skin to prevent frostbite.
